nodes.bodyText: Something to be aware of (I guess it's fine for now but will affect the next stage of changes): this will spin up numThreads many core threads and core thread timeout is not allowed by the executor returned here, so some changes will be needed when we extend this to cover that.
Yeah, once we do task scaling, this is set to 1 instead
I think you can delete it and put in a JsonIgnoreProperties annotation at the top.
would be good to add some documentation on how the self-tuning mechanism works

nodes.bodyText:
I'd question whether we want to place a cap on MAX_PAUSE_MILLIS: it seems a bit unexpected that if the user configures the gap to be 10 seconds for whatever reason we just throw it away. Even if we think that's ok I think it makes sense to fail more aggressively.
In other words I'd go for
initial = max(min, config)
min = 1
max = max(5000, config)

Note that if you go this route you may need some special integer mathematics in line 47...
Makes sense, I now just use it as both initial and max. Do we want to do something like max should always be at least 2 * initial instead?
at this point it's probably worth having a sweepTwentyBatchesWithOutcome(long)?
Probably worth calling out this is not yet enabled by default and please talk to the AtlasDB team if you want to use it.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+type: improvement
+improvement:
+  description: |-
+    Targeted sweep runtime configuration now has a `enableAutoTuning` parameter. While true, targeted sweep will dynamically adjust the pause between sweep iterations based on the amount of work that was done. It will, furthermore, attempt to read a full batch (100k) of entries to sweep whenever possible.
